summary: Professor McGonagall, in regards to Pettigrew, would it be an option to set a caterwauling charm on him so it goes off if he...
question: Professor McGonagall, in regards to Pettigrew, would it be an option to set a caterwauling charm on him so it goes off if he gets within a certain distance of another student?
answer: Minerva: That is something we may need to consider, if we can’t get through to him any other way.  However, I believe that would be more of a nuisance than a help seeing as this is a school and he will be around other students all the time.

reblog.comment: Minerva: That is something we may need to consider, if we can’t get through to him any other way.  However, I believe that would be more of a nuisance than a help seeing as this is a school and he will be around other students all the time.

blog.name: harry-potter-and-the-slytherin
blog.description: Elsa| She/her| Slytherin| Year 4| side blog

summary: Why isn't there a mini game in Hogwarts a mystery that on winter break you can celebrate Christmas with the Weasley family. OMG...
body:
Why isn’t there a mini game in Hogwarts a mystery that on winter break you can celebrate Christmas with the Weasley family. OMG can y'all imagine cute little Ginny talking to Bill about Hogwarts and her having 1000 questions. Can y'all imagine Fred and George doing simple pranks on percy because they aren’t so good at pranking people yet. Can y'all imagine if Barnaby Lee would be able to stay at the Weasleys too because he doesn’t like that his parents knew you-know-who. And him and Charlie talking about different magical creatures. And maybe we could get a Weasly sweatshirt 👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻

I just want a Hogwarts a mystery mini game

blog.name: bitingdownpromo
blog.title: Biting Down
blog.description: The year is 2027. The wizarding community is tearing itself apart as danger lurks around every corner; the possibility of a wizarding epidemic sends the community into a frenzy that brings a new evil to power. Will you fight for what you believe, or take the path of least resistance?

summary:
the electronics of your heart...
 The year is 2027. Nearly three decades have passed since the battle at Hogwarts and the...
caption:
the electronics of your heart…

The year is 2027. Nearly three decades have passed since the battle at Hogwarts and the wizarding world continues its uphill climb towards a slow, tumultuous recovery. Danger lurks around every corner as the possibility of a wizarding epidemic sends the wizarding community into a frenzy that brings a new evil to power.

see how fast they fall apart…

Will you fight for what you believe, or take the path of least resistance? Whether you flee or bite down and take the heat, the next great war is coming and the outcome is up to you. Welcome to Biting Down.

home | plot | rules | wanted connections | character suggestions | application

summary: I once told a potterhead friend I had recently made that my favorite Harry Potter character was Draco Malfoy and not Harry. They...
body: I once told a potterhead friend I had recently made that my favorite Harry Potter character was Draco Malfoy and not Harry. They looked at me weirdly and said, “Draco Malfoy sucks.” And I, nonchalantly, replied with, “yeah, Harry’s dick.” I haven’t heard from them since.

summary:
Remus: Prongs... you can't do this
James: Yes I can! I know it
Remus: You can't just walk the great hall in like a...
body:
Remus: Prongs… you can’t do this

James: Yes I can! I know it

Remus: You can’t just walk the great hall in like a stag…

James:…

Remus:…

James: Yes I can!

And no-one could ever explain why there was a deer in the great hall, but sometimes it was there and than everyone could pet him.

blog.name: daughterofamity
blog.title: You Should See Me In A Crown.
blog.description: Em. I'm multifandom, although at the moment it's mainly Sherlock. books include Harry Potter, Percy Jackson, maze runner, thg, chaos walking trilogy. Tv shows include teen wolf, gossip girl, the originals, riverdale, scream...

body:
The Harry Potter Movies

Okay, so I’ve been seeing a lot of people complaining about/criticising the movies lately. And as a book fan, I get it, they missed out things (characters, Ginny’s personality, etc)

But we also have to remember that these films are still really good, and quite faithful to the books. The general storyline is there, they have some great scenes, great actors… They are some of the best adaptations I’ve seen, I mean just compare them to the Percy Jackson movies for example. Expecting a perfect book adaptation is impossible.

I just think that we tend to focus on the negatives and not enough on the (many) positive aspects of the films.
